reviews.text: I spent 2 nights at new year eve expecting to be a real five star hotel ( I travel a lot worldwide and I have been in many luxury hotels). I never spent a night hear before but I knew its restaurant and lobby bar. That´s Ok, and that´s all. Room are wide but they need maintenance. Swimming pool is tiny and share with owners of W residences, so only few guest can enjoy it.
reviews.title: Not at all that you expect for a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Finally, they take a guarantee from your credit card during check in ( in my case wasUS$800) I never did it before in other hotel; only they asked me for my credit card but not charged any amount. I got back to my credit card, this amount four days later
reviews.title: Hmmmm, W.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you have experienced real 5 stars hotels worldwide, you notice this is not!!!!
reviews.title: One of the best W experiences ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Odd this one. The first major major point was that i was advised by a friend to stay here due to the wonderful roof top pool and bar. I thought that as i'm in Chile for Christmas and Boxing day that would be just wonderful. However the bar was closed so you couldn't by law take a drink up to the pool, no matter how well you disguised what you were drinking. Not only this but the bar was having work on it so the pool wasn't as quiet as one would hope.
reviews.title: Trendy with a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager said that the web site clearly stated that the pool bar was shut, i said it wasn't and left it at that, however i noticed that the reason was because on the mobile version of the site it doesn't have that information. Fail.
reviews.title: A great W experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sad that gold status didnt score us a larger room, but I did get to pick my favorite of three options, which was delightful and allowed for some good night's sleep! Loved the front desk and concierge staff, great location, would highly recommend. Breakfast buffet was expansive.
reviews.title: No upgrade available, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very good stay at W , 5 nights.
reviews.title: trendy with good service

reviews.text: The hotel looks actually better than in the picture with nice but small rooms, and large, original, gorgeous public areas. Most rooms have a very nice view over santiago, including the swimming pool in the top floor. Few sunbeds though so in sunny days it might be an issue to get a place. Breakfast was also very good and we found the service to be friendly and professional, and not cold or too relax as it can be in other W hotels. Ask for a higher floor for view and quietness. Location is central, at walking distance of metro and avenues to get a taxi. would recommend it for leisure or business purposes. Hotel is however somewhat expensive for santiago.
reviews.title: Great location and amenities, so-so service
Very trendy and pleasant hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the W Santiago for a couple of nights on the way to Patagonia and the Atacama desert. The location and amenities are great - good neighborhood, fantastic gym facility, spa in the hotel, and good restaurants, including a great breakfast. Service was spotty - some staff were terrific, others pretty indifferent.

reviews.title: Welcoming W
reviews.text: Two days with my wife to discover Santiago and Valpareso

Amazing interior design, good service, great breakfast, excellent gym. Located in one of the best neighborhoods of Santiago, with very nice shops and restaurants all around. When I was there it was fully booked and I guess they gave me one of their worst rooms (low floor, a bit small and noisy, but still quite good).
reviews.title: Very trendy and fashionable.

reviews.text: I expent 3 days in this hotel. I was impressed with the room which is well decorated and has a nice view of the city. The servive is also good and the staff was always helpful and friendly. There is a great lounge close to the concierge and also one of the bests nightclubs in Santiago. The gym is fantastic although the pool (November 2012) was closed for renovation. I recommend a visit to the cigar shop and to the wine shop in the lower floor. Next time I go to Santiago I will certainly be back.
reviews.title: Great hotel with nice restaurant and nightclub

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, It’s trendy
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: Yes, It’s chick
reviews.title: Great place ... but mainly outside the room!

reviews.text: Yes, It’s the place where celebrities would spend their nights
reviews.title: The greedy W ambassadors

reviews.text: As stylish as all W hotels, with good facilities, great breakfast etc. Great location next to many restaurants and bars. Superb wine shop and cafe in the same building.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, sometimes too trendy for its own good

reviews.text: Sometimes, there is a tendency for style over practical substance, e.g. when the only place that the maid can hang the dressing gown is on the only hooks in the bathroom that are, unfortunately, directly below the shower, you know that the design "isn't quite right"
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close (~15 minutes walk) to the newly opened mega (=nothing distinctive) Costanera shopping mall
reviews.title: Chaotic but good

reviews.text: This hotel is wonderfully decorated. Pool is awesome. Our room was huge. Breakfast (included in rate) was copious. Nice walking area. We loved the W. Service was quite efficient (one episode of room service bizarreness). I know others have complained but we were farily well attended to during our stay.
reviews.title: Great way to spend a layover night

reviews.text: We stayed in the W for thre nights. In general this hotel is very good. We stayed in a Cool corner room which was large and comfy - could not be faulted. The pool was also superb, it is on the rooftop with great views of snow capped mountains (we did virtually have it to ourselves though -as it is quite small if there were more people could soon become crowded). The bar is ok, if expensive and the staff generally very helpful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but more about style than comfort
